ai-anya-e0101n4:222_3: After that either four or five impulsions impel on that same object, the last one of which is an impulsion of the fine-material sphere belonging to the fourth jhāna. The rest are of the kinds already stated .
ai-anya-e0101n4:222_4: And this is the fourth kind of feeling associated with pleasant feeling.
ai-anya-e0101n4:222_5: And although it is associated with equanimity, it is prevailed.
ai-anya-e0101n4:222_6: And at this point, giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, they enter and remain in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-anya-e0101n4:222_7: and so he has attained the fourth absorption, which has three factors, possesses two factors, is good in three ways, possesses ten characteristics, and is endowed with ten characteristics.
ai-anya-e0101n4:223_1: Herein, with the abandoning of pleasure and pain: with the abandoning of bodily pleasure and bodily pain.
ai-anya-e0101n4:223_2: With the previous: which took place before, not in the moment of the fourth jhāna.
ai-anya-e0101n4:223_3: Disappearance of joy and grief: with the previous disappearance of the two, that is, mental bliss and mental pain; with the abandoning of the two, namely, both of the laypeople and renunciates, is what is said.
ai-anya-e0101n4:224_1: In the four absorptions, each instance.
ai-anya-e0101n4:224_2: For mental joy is only abandoned at the moment of the fourth-jhāna access,
ai-anya-e0101n4:224_3: while bodily pain, mental grief, and bodily bliss are abandoned respectively at the moments of access of the first, second, and third jhānas.
ai-anya-e0101n4:224_4: In this way, when the faculties are given up and stilled, it can still be understood that the Faculties of the faculties by means of the terminator faculties and analysis of pleasure and pain arise in the same way.
ai-anya-e0101n4:225_0: But if these are only abandoned at the moments of access of the several jhānas, why is their cessation said to. take place in the jhāna itself in the following passage: “But where does the faculty cease without anything left over, mendicant?”
ai-anya-e0101n4:225_1: dwells having attained the first absorption.
ai-anya-e0101n4:225_2: That’s where the faculty of pain that’s arisen ceases without anything left over.
ai-anya-e0101n4:225_3: And where does that faculty of pleasure that’s arisen cease without anything left over? ...
ai-anya-e0101n4:225_5: Because of the cessation of defilements,
ai-anya-e0101n4:225_6: For in the first jhāna, etc., it is their reinforced cessation, not just their cessation, that takes place.
ai-anya-e0101n4:225_7: At the moment of access it is just their cessation, not their reinforced cessation, that takes place.
ai-anya-e0101n4:226_0: For if a man has entered upon the first jhāna and weakened in the first jhāna, then for non-decluded in the second-jhāna access or decrease, it may be appropriate to say that there could be reappearing in that way.
ai-anya-e0101n4:226_1: Or else, though it has ceased during access, it has not absolutely ceased there since it is not quite beaten out by opposition.
ai-anya-e0101n4:226_2: But during absorption the whole body is showered with bliss owing to pervasion by happiness.
ai-anya-e0101n4:226_3: And during the second-jhāna access too, which has multiple advertings, there could be rearising of the mental grief faculty, although it had already ceased there, because it arises when there is bodily weariness and mental vexation, which have applied thought and sustained thought.
ai-anya-e0101n4:226_4: but it does not arise when applied and sustained thought are absent.
ai-anya-e0101n4:226_5: When it arises, it does so in the presence of applied and sustained thought, and they are not abandoned in the second-jhāna access; but this is not so in the second jhāna itself because its conditions are abandoned there.
ai-anya-e0101n4:226_6: Likewise in the third-jhāna access there could be rearising of the abandoned bodily pleasure faculty in one whose body was pervaded by the superior materiality originated by the consciousness associated with the happiness. But not so in the third jhāna itself.
ai-anya-e0101n4:226_7: For in the third jhāna the happiness that is a condition for the bodily bliss has ceased entirely.
ai-anya-e0101n4:226_8: Likewise in the fourth-jhāna access there could be rejoicing the joy faculty without applied thought. But if it has been abandoned there, he may not because of the fourth jhāna.
ai-anya-e0101n4:226_9: And that’s why in that case the arisen pain faculty ceases without anything left over.
ai-anya-e0101n4:227_0: Here it may be asked: if these kinds of feeling are abandoned in that, why are they brought in here?”
ai-anya-e0101n4:227_2: For the neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling described here by the words “which has neither-pain-nor-pleasure” is subtle, hard to recognize and not readily grasped. So just as, when a cattle-herd wants to catch a refractory ox that cannot be caught at all by approaching it, he collects all the cattle into one pen and lets them out one by one, and then he says “That is it; catch it,” and so it gets caught as well, so too the Buddha has collected all these five kinds of feeling together so that they can be grasped readily;
ai-anya-e0101n4:227_3: for this is how they are shown. The pleasure and happiness that aren’t able to arise in them.
ai-anya-e0101n4:228_0: Besides, this may be understood as said in order to show the condition for the neither-painful-nor-pleasant mind-deliverance.
ai-anya-e0101n4:228_1: For the abandoning of bodily pain, etc., according as condition:
ai-anya-e0101n4:228_2: “Four conditions are necessary to attain the neutral release of the heart.
ai-anya-e0101n4:228_3: It’s when, giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness.
ai-anya-e0101n4:228_4: he dwells having attained the fourth absorption.
ai-anya-e0101n4:228_5: These are the four conditions for the attainment of the neither-painful-nor-pleasant mind.”
ai-anya-e0101n4:229_0: Or alternatively, they are stated here since they abandon greed for the purpose of abandoning identity view, etc., in this way they are stated here even when they described.
ai-anya-e0101n4:230_0: Or alternatively, they can be understood as mentioned for the purpose of showing that greed and hate are very far away owing to the removal of their conditions;
ai-anya-e0101n4:230_1: for of these kinds of happiness is a condition for greed,
ai-anya-e0101n4:230_2: pain and sadness are a condition for sadness.
ai-anya-e0101n4:230_3: So with the removal of pleasure , etc., greed and hate are very far away since they are removed along with their conditions.
ai-anya-e0101n4:231_0: without pain, without pleasure, and with complete purity of mindfulness owing to equanimity,
ai-anya-e0101n4:231_1: through the power of pleasure and happiness—
ai-anya-e0101n4:231_2: By this he indicates the third kind of feeling that is in opposition, which is independent on suffering, not-self in suffering.
ai-anya-e0101n4:231_3: A third neutral feeling is said to be “equanimous bliss”.
ai-anya-e0101n4:231_4: It has the characteristic of experiencing what is contrary to both the desirable and the undesirable. Its function is neutral. Its manifestation is unevident. Its proximate cause should be understood as the cessation of pleasure .
ai-anya-e0101n4:232_0: And purity of mindfulness due to equanimity: has purity of mindfulness brought about by equanimity.
ai-anya-e0101n4:232_1: For the mindfulness in this jhāna is quite purified, and its purification is effected by equanimity, not by anything else.
ai-anya-e0101n4:232_2: That is why it is said to have purity of mindfulness due to equanimity.
ai-anya-e0101n4:232_3: Also in the Vibhaṅga: “This mindfulness is cleared, purified, clarified, by equanimity;
ai-anya-e0101n4:232_4: hence it is said to have purity of mindfulness due to equanimity” .
ai-anya-e0101n4:232_5: And the equanimity due to which there comes to be this purity of mindfulness should be understood as specific neutrality in meaning.
ai-anya-e0101n4:232_6: And not only mindfulness is purified by it here, but also all associated states. However, the teaching is given under the heading of mindfulness.
ai-anya-e0101n4:233_0: Herein, this equanimity exists in the three lower jhānas in the three lower jhānas.
ai-anya-e0101n4:233_1: But just as when the sun has vanished in the sky on the day and on the night, so too, when its particular individual essences are unconcerned, then in order to get rid of the opposite kind states, it is purified by day or in the first-jhāna accessible for the day or in one whose mind is pure, etc., and also in the case of the equanimous from all the first three watches of the night.
ai-anya-e0101n4:233_2: and because it is not purified, the conascent mindfulness and other states are not purified either, like the unpurified crescent moon’s radiance by day.
ai-anya-e0101n4:233_3: That’s why no one among these first jhānas is said to have purity of mindfulness due to equanimity.
ai-anya-e0101n4:233_4: But here this crescent moon consisting in specific neutrality is utterly pure because it is not outshone by the glare of the opposing states consisting in applied thought, etc., and because it has the night of equanimity-as-feeling for its ally.
ai-anya-e0101n4:233_5: And since it is purified, the conascent mindfulness and other states are purified and clear also, like the purified crescent moon’s radiance.
ai-anya-e0101n4:233_6: That, it should be understood, is why only this jhāna is said to have purity of mindfulness due to equanimity.
ai-anya-e0101n4:234_0: Fourth: it is fourth in number;
ai-anya-e0101n4:234_2: Then it should be understood that in the comprehension of the one factor should be understood as the abandoning of joy and happiness.
ai-anya-e0101n4:234_3: But that joy is actually abandoned in the first impulsions of the same cognitive series .
ai-anya-e0101n4:234_4: hence it is called its factor of abandoning.
ai-anya-e0101n4:234_5: The possession of the two factors should be understood as the arising of the two, namely, equanimity as feeling and unification of mind.
ai-anya-e0101n4:234_6: The rest is as in the case of the first jhāna.
ai-anya-e0101n4:234_7: This, in the first place, is according to the fourfold reckoning of jhāna.
ai-anya-e0101n4:235_0: The account of the fivefold jhāna
ai-anya-e0101n4:236_1: When, however, he is developing fivefold jhāna, then, on emerging from the now familiar first jhāna, he can regard the flaws in it in this way: “This attainment is threatened by the nearness of the hindrances, and its factors are weakened by the grossness of applied thought. ” He can bring the second jhāna to mind as quieter and so end his attachment to the first jhāna and set about doing what is needed for attaining the second.
ai-anya-e0101n4:236_2: Now, he emerges from the first jhāna mindfully and fully aware; and only applied thought appears gross to him as he reviews the jhāna factors, while the sustained thought, etc., appear peaceful.
ai-anya-e0101n4:236_3: Then, as he brings that same sign to mind as “earth, earth” again and again with the purpose of abandoning the gross factor and obtaining the peaceful factors, the second jhāna arises in him in the way already described.
ai-anya-e0101n4:236_5: The four beginning with sustained thought are the factors that it possesses.
ai-anya-e0101n4:236_6: The rest is as already stated.
ai-anya-e0101n4:237_0: When this has been obtained in this way, and once he has mastery in the five ways already described, then on emerging from the now familiar second jhāna he can regard the flaws in it in this way: “This attainment is threatened by the nearness of applied thought, and its factors are weakened by the grosness of sustained thought. ” He can bring the third absorption to mind as quieter and so end his attachment to the second jhāna and set about doing what is needed for attaining the third.
ai-anya-e0101n4:237_1: When he has emerged from the second jhāna happiness appears gross to him as he reviews the jhāna factors with mindfulness and full awareness, while bliss and unification appear peaceful.
ai-anya-e0101n4:237_2: Then, as he brings that same sign to mind as “earth, earth” again and again with the purpose of abandoning the gross factor and obtaining the peaceful factors, the third absorption arises in him in the way already described.
ai-anya-e0101n4:237_3: Its factor of abandoning is sustained thought only. The three beginning with happiness, as in the second jhāna in the fourfold reckoning, are the factors that it possesses.
ai-anya-e0101n4:237_4: The rest is as already stated.
